intro: Echium australe var. brevicalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value. This variety is particularly adapted to arid environments and is often used in native gardens for its drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal.
